sentences.sContent: The officials said that they had been offered bribes before an important game.
sentences.sCn: 这几名官员说，有人在一场重要比赛之前向他们行贿。

sentences.sContent: The only way we could get into the country was by bribing the border officials.
sentences.sCn: 我们要进入这个国家，唯一的办法是贿赂边境官员。

remMethod.val: 要想抱得新娘(bride)归， 就要贿赂(bribe)丈母娘 → 贿赂

trans.tranOther: money or a gift that you illegally give someone to persuade them to do something for you
to illegally give someone, especially a public official, money or a gift in order to persuade them to do something for you
